content:
Certainly, here are some options for tours and guides for visiting historic sites in Dublin:

1. Kilmainham Gaol Museum Tour - This guided tour includes a visit to Kilmainham Gaol, where you'll learn about the prison's history and the role it played in Ireland's fight for independence.

2. 1916 Rebellion Walking Tour - Led by a local historian, this tour takes you on a walking tour of Dublin's historic landmarks, including the GPO and other sites associated with the 1916 Easter Rising.

3. Dublin Castle State Apartments Tour - This tour takes you through Dublin Castle's State Apartments, where you can learn about the castle's history and see the rooms where historic negotiations took place.

4. Trinity College Book of Kells Tour - This tour includes a visit to the Book of Kells exhibit at Trinity College, as well as a guided tour of the college's historic campus.

5. Glasnevin Cemetery Museum Tour - The Glasnevin Cemetery Museum offers guided tours of the cemetery, where you can learn about some of Ireland's most prominent politicians, writers, and rebels.

There are also several hop-on-hop-off bus tours in Dublin that stop at many of the city's historic sites, providing a convenient way to see the sights.
